Summary Heading: Great deal for a short stay
Summary: Clean, modern, comfortable, spacious. Microwave and refrigerator came in handy. Location is not busy but very safe, and close enough to everything that this is a great value if it's not your home base.

Summary Heading: Nice updated pet friendly hotel in Irvine
Summary: My family and I stayed here for 1 night on our post Christmas road trip.   A big plus for us are hotels that are pet friendly since we enjoy bringing our dog on road trips.  Our room was updated and spacious with a small fridge and microwave.  The bed is quite comfortable but I had trouble falling asleep since I could hear planes flying right over the hotel about every 15 mins.  It finally quieted down sometime after 11pm.  We also went down to the indoor pool area - the pool is just average and could use an upgrade.  The water was warmer in some sections of the pool than other sections.  There was no hot tub either.  The breakfast was good and had a nice variety of choices such as waffles, oatmeal w/ fixings, cereal, yogurt, eggs, sausage, and fruit.  We would choose to stay

Summary: This was a short one night stay over the holidays. Kristina was amazing - she went out of her way to make me feel welcome and helped with my request. The room was spacious, clean and comfortable.  The breakfast was standard with sausage and scrambled eggs. Nice coffee bar 24/7. Convenient location, close to the freeway.  Only complaint was the weak shower water pressure and the $17 parking even though there was no card key entrance or security. Anyone could park there.

Summary: Went to Irvine visiting friends and family last weekend. Stayed in Springhills Irvine and it was great. Clean hotel, wonderful staff (Kristina at front desk was very helpful), nice breakfast. Will definitely stay again.

Usually not a big deal but I had some bath bombs I wanted to use before flying, haha.  Otherwise a convenient place to stay near the airport.

The room was spacious, I worked for 2 days at the desk, which is on the other side of the bedroom so when i was watching tv in bed it was like I was not there for work (could not see the desk). The hotel itself is modern and renovated, with all of its furniture and fixtures up to date. Aside from the physical attributes, what made my stay especially memorable was the friendly staff! The only problem I have with this hotel is $12 parking fees. Given the location, it is totally unwarranted. Also, the air conditioner should have been more centrally located in the room. The room is clean and spacious and could use an update, looks a bit dated.  Overall I would stay again, but for the parking fees.

Summary: Quality, friendly staffs, clean suite, nice breakfast! This hotel should be rated 4 stars for its spacious and nice suite. It is much better value and more modern than some usual 4 stars hotel in the area.   For the amount spent, this is the best hotel for your stay. It may not have all the bell and whistle, but the nice courteous staffs and the suite are enough to make up for. I highly recommended. You won't be disappointed!

Summary: I would recommend this hotel in general.  The staff was very nice.  The room was nice.  But for a family with small kids, I think other hotels would be better.  It really comes down to small details, such as the TV stations available for the kids.  No Disney or age appropriate stations... just basic stations.  But the shows on these are really not the best for my kids, so the kids get restless until we leave the room.  Had to unplug the lamp because the cord was dragging across the room and was dangerous for our toddlers.  No bathtub in our room, just a shower.    The free breakfast is always nice, but had the typical food as other places.  Very crowded on the day we were there.  Weak coffee.  For tired parents, this was disappointing. Summary: Spent 1 night before our early flight out the following morning at this property.  There were 4 of us and the room was designed with 2 double beds, a pull out sofa, a large walk-in closet, dresser, shower and sink area separate from the toilet room. Furnishings are modern Ikea like, functional with comfortable beds. Free airport shuttle starts at 5am and even though the breakfast wasn't set out yet, there was fruit and coffee. The gal at the front desk offered to put something together for us to take with, which we declined, but was very nice and thoughtful of her. Shuttle driver pleasant and cheery. Reasonably priced, and since I live in OC, I would stay there again if I had an early morning flight to have a restful night before a long day of travel ahead.
Manager Response: Hello Cleeclub,  Thank you so much for staying with us and your kind compliments on our furnishings and staff. Would also take my family to this property if vacationing in this area.

Summary Heading: Well priced, clean, and convenient to many restaurants and the freeway.
Summary: Good price, very clean, and surprisingly busy for a weekend in a light industry neighborhood.  Several other guests were with their children so I assume they were on a short vacation.  Very reasonably priced for the area.  We were able to take our morning 2 mile walk and felt safe in the neighborhood on a weekend.  Large beautiful trees shaded our walk and we did meet a couple of other walkers too.  Staff was pleasant and efficient, room was actually a suite with a large desk, a sofa, coffee table, and plenty of lamps.  I liked the fact that there were two sinks, one in the lavatory and one in the shower area.  Also plenty of mirrors and electrical outlets.  Room includes a refrigerator and microwave.  We stayed in room 150 which was quiet and not too far from either the lobby

They have great furnishings, very comfortable beds and carpets, a well-designed room, nice colors, plenty of lights, a comfortable couch, and a nice desk to do work on. A good breakfast and a nice meeting space near the lobby, colorful and lovely smelling gardens, and a fitness center with weights. Truly nothing to complain about, which is very rare for me!

They charge 12 dollars for parking which is unusual at Springhill. The location is decent If you're at Irvine for business. it's about 10 minutes from the airport at rush hour.  I ordered a package to be delivered at the hotel that never arrived although one of the staff members signed for it.  The bed was too firm and I didn't sleep well. There was some renovations going on, but signs were clearly posted so it wasn't a bother at all. Every staff member I encountered was extremely friendly and helpful.   Be warned that there are planes flying ahead, which is expected since it's right next to the airport. Unfortunately my business trip had me working the night shift, so it was a little difficult to sleep during the day.   Breakfast is provided and included some hot items (eggs, sausage)  as well as fresh fruit, and various breads.   Overall I thoroughly enjoyed my stay and would recommend this hotel to family and friends.

We look forward to hosting you or any of your friends and family in the future and we all wish you continued safe travels.  Yours in hospitality,  John Dominguez Assistant General Manager

I just have figure out where to buy some cutlery before hand next time.

The breakfast was typical Springhill breakfast (eggs, sausage, breads, cereal, juice, yogurt, etc).  The hotel looks dated from the outside, and dated, but less so, on the inside. Summary: Stayed here on business when flying in and out of John Wayne Airport.  Room was spacious, with separate sitting and desk area.  A real plus was the separate room for the toilet. Summary: This is a great place to stay for work or play. The room is set up with a desk , mini frig,microwave ,.Lots pf place to plug in tv eaxy to see for any part of the room. An nice breakfast with a wide selection that will please most people. Easy access to the 55 and 405 freeway. A good place to consider in the area , Free parking and a friendly staff and added bonus.

The decor is somewhat modern and not exactly my taste, but the overall accommodations were very good.  The breakfast was free, so I can't complain about the price.  The breakfast was good, not great, but did I mention it was also free?   Bottom line, I travel with 4 ladies (1 wife + 3 daughters) and there was plenty of space and enough mirrors, sinks, etc for everyone to get ready in the morning.  In my world, that's a win!

Breakfast was good and kept very nicely. The juice was terrible. The staff I dealt with were very nice.

During my stay, the rooms in this hotel were subject to significant airport noise, probably more so than any other airport hotel at which I have stayed. Rooms are large and very well appointed, divided in the middle by a desk area and glass divider.  Toilet and shower are in two separate rooms.  There is a nice, small indoor pool.  Breakfast was included in our package (and I believe all packages).  Nice with fruit, cereals, meats, eggs, and the typical light breakfast foods encountered in places of this type.  Marriott comfortable beds and pillows made the sleeping easy.  Overall, for the price and quality, this is a great place to stay!  The staff was knowledgeable and friendly.

David Allen General Manager
